meanings.definition: To disturb the condition, action, or function of something
meanings.sent1: The loud noise deraigned my concentration while studying.
meanings.sent2: The storm deraigned the peaceful atmosphere of the garden.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel deraigned the neat arrangement of the bird feeders.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected power outage deraigned the flow of the presentation.
meanings.sent5: The spilled paint deraigned the pristine white canvas.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to become insane or mentally disturbed
meanings.sent1: The eerie movie deraigned my friend's sense of reality.
meanings.sent2: The traumatic event deraigned his mental stability.
meanings.sent3: The confusing puzzle game deraigned our focus but made us laugh.
meanings.sent4: The constant stress deraigned her mind like a turbulent storm.
meanings.sent5: The ghost story deraigned their peaceful night with fear.
